name: BlockFilter
description: The BlockFilter class is a specialized filter in JSMacros used with the WorldScanner system to filter blocks based on their properties and method results.
overview: The BlockFilter class works by invoking a specified method from BlockHelper on each block being evaluated, applying a comparison filter to the method result, and performing a boolean evaluation. It extends the ClassWrapperFilter class and provides a powerful way to create complex block filtering logic. It supports all public, no-parameter methods from BlockHelper, works with different return types (String, Number, Boolean), and supports logical operations (AND, OR, XOR, NOT). This class is primarily used internally by the WorldScannerBuilder but can be instantiated directly for advanced scenarios.

constructors.description: Creates a new BlockFilter instance with the specified method and filter criteria.

parameters.name: methodName
parameters.description: The name of the method from BlockHelper to invoke on each block

parameters.name: methodArgs
parameters.description: Arguments to pass to the method when invoked (typically empty for no-parameter methods)

parameters.name: filterArgs
parameters.description: Arguments for the filter comparison operation

methods.name: apply
methods.description: Applies the filter to a block and returns the result.

methods.name: and
methods.description: Combines with another filter using AND logic.

methods.name: or
methods.description: Combines with another filter using OR logic.

methods.name: xor
methods.description: Combines with another filter using XOR logic.
